SEARCH
Package com.wileyedge.fashiontrendanalysis.controller

Class ProductController

java.lang.Object
com.wileyedge.fashiontrendanalysis.controller.ProductController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/products") @CrossOrigin(origins="*", allowedHeaders="*", methods={GET,POST,PUT,DELETE}) public class ProductController extends Object
Controller for managing operations related to products.

      Returns:
      the product with the specified ID, or 404 if not found

      Associates a designer with a product.
      Parameters:
      designerId - The ID of the designer to associate.
      productId - The ID of the product to associate with the designer.
      Returns:
      A response indicating the success of the operation.

      Dissociates a designer from a product.
      Parameters:
      designerId - The ID of the designer to dissociate.
      productId - The ID of the product to dissociate the designer from.

      A response indicating the success of the operation.

    • setProductPopularityForTrend

      Sets the popularity score of a product for a specific trend.
      Parameters:
      productId - The ID of the product.
      trendId - The ID of the trend.
      score - The popularity score to set.
      Returns:
      A response indicating the success of the operation.

    • getProductPopularityForTrend

      @GetMapping("/{productId}/popularity/{trendId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Integer> getProductPopularityForTrend(@PathVariable Long productId, @PathVariable Long trendId)
      Fetches the popularity score of a product for a specific trend.
      Parameters:
      productId - The ID of the product.
      trendId - The ID of the trend.
      Returns:
      The popularity score of the specified product for the specified trend.

      Returns:

    • showVisualisationPage

      @GetMapping("/visualisation") public String showVisualisationPage()
      Serves the visualisation page to the client.
      Returns:
      A string representing the name of the HTML template (without the ".html" extension) that should be rendered and returned to the client.
